title: Create Art Style Guide
purpose: Describe the core function Create Art Style Guide.
guardrails: Maintain exploratory scope; do not produce production‑ready assets.
Use only royalty‑free or internally owned reference materials.
Document decisions and rationales for each aesthetic choice.
Keep iteration loops time‑boxed to avoid perfectionism.
Ensure accessibility considerations (e.g., color blindness) are acknowledged.
Align visual style with the game's concept and target audience.
Avoid overcomplicating guidelines; strive for clarity and conciseness.
Maintain organized file structure and naming conventions for assets.
Solicit feedback from cross‑disciplinary teams (audio, design).
Secure sign‑offs before finalizing to prevent later rework.

tasks.title: Research visual inspirations and define aesthetic pillars (color, typography, shapes, textures).
tasks.description: Collect visual inspirations and references to establish the aesthetic direction and document key pillars such as color, typography, shapes, and textures, ensuring consistency with the game's concept and audience.

deliverables.description: PDF board compiling at least five annotated visual references that represent the desired mood and style for the game.

acceptance.text: Contains at least five annotated reference images describing why each was chosen.
Sources are properly licensed or owned.
Annotations link the image to aesthetic pillars.

deliverables.description: Document detailing at least four aesthetic pillars (color, typography, shapes, textures) with narrative rationale, visual examples, and guidelines for implementation.

acceptance.text: Lists at least four aesthetic pillars.
Provides rationale and visual examples for each pillar.
Approved by art director and aligns with game concept.

tasks.title: Develop color palettes, typography samples, and exploratory sketches.
tasks.description: Create and document color palettes, typography treatments, and exploratory sketches to build a cohesive visual language.

deliverables.description: PDF containing at least three distinct color palettes, each with swatch samples and corresponding hex/RGB values.

acceptance.text: Includes at least three color palettes.
Each palette lists colors with hex codes.
Explains the purpose or mood associated with each palette.

deliverables.description: Document showcasing samples of at least two font families with hierarchy examples (headings, body text, captions) tailored for the game's UI and narrative elements.

acceptance.text: Shows samples of at least two font families with heading, subheading, and body styles.
Explains the use case of each font.
Fonts are legible across screen sizes.

deliverables.description: Collection of at least five exploratory sketches demonstrating style variations, silhouettes, and concept layouts.

acceptance.text: Contains at least five sketches exploring character and environment silhouettes or compositions.
Annotations explain key design ideas.
Scanned or exported at a readable resolution.

tasks.title: Produce sample environment art and draft composition/lighting/texture guidelines.
tasks.description: Produce a sample environment artwork and derive guidelines for composition, lighting, and texture to guide production artists.

deliverables.description: High-resolution concept art piece depicting a representative environment with attention to composition, lighting, and texturing.

acceptance.text: Environment concept art approved by art lead.
Demonstrates the intended composition, lighting, and texture style.

deliverables.description: Document outlining guidelines for composition, lighting, and texture application derived from the sample concept art.

acceptance.text: Lists at least five guidelines covering composition, lighting, and texture.
Provides examples or references for each guideline.
Reviewed and approved by art director.

tasks.title: Draft notes on audio-visual synergy and accessibility considerations.
tasks.description: Document how audio and visuals work together harmoniously and ensure the aesthetic choices accommodate accessibility guidelines.

deliverables.description: PDF summarizing how audio elements complement visual cues, with at least three examples of sound/visual pairings across interactions or scenes.

acceptance.text: Describes at least three sound/visual pairings.
Explains how each pairing enhances immersion and feedback.
Reviewed by audio and art leads.

deliverables.description: Markdown document enumerating considerations and guidelines to ensure the art style remains accessible (e.g., color-blind palettes, legible fonts, contrast ratios).

acceptance.text: Addresses at least three accessibility topics such as color blindness, font legibility, and UI contrast.
Provides guidelines or resources for each topic.
Aligned with accessibility standards (WCAG).

tasks.title: Compile all elements into a cohesive draft art style guide.
tasks.description: Assemble the collected elements into a cohesive draft art style guide.

deliverables.description: Draft of the art style guide compiling pillars, color palettes, typography, sketches, environment art, guidelines, synergy notes, and accessibility considerations into a cohesive document.

acceptance.text: Integrates all earlier deliverables into a cohesive guide.
Maintains consistent formatting and structure.
Ready for team review.

tasks.title: Hold a review session and collect feedback.
tasks.description: Conduct a review session with stakeholders and capture actionable feedback to inform revisions.

deliverables.description: Notes capturing feedback from cross-disciplinary review sessions, including at least five actionable suggestions and decisions.

acceptance.text: Includes at least five actionable suggestions from reviewers.
Documents decisions and next steps for each suggestion.
Shared with all stakeholders within 24 hours of the session.

tasks.title: Revise and finalize the art style guide for production handoff.
tasks.description: Revise the draft art style guide based on feedback and finalize it for production handoff.

deliverables.description: Finalized art style guide incorporating feedback, with layout and content suitable for production artists, including sign-off records from leadership.

acceptance.text: Incorporates all agreed-upon feedback.
Signed off by art director and production leads.
Stored in version control with appropriate naming.
